→ JavaScript to be Included at OS Level in Yosemite

Jun 7, 2014 • ∞
1 minute read

Federico Viticci on Apple’s decision to include JavaScript as an OS-level scripting and automation language:

This is an interesting change for automation on OS X going forward, and JavaScript will be available alongside AppleScript in the Script Editor.

I’m not sure how I feel about this decision. Selfishly, a part of me is excited that a more robust programming language (sorry, Applescript) is being included (and in a sponsored fashion) at Yosemite’s OS level. However, another part is currently thinking, If Apple does this, we’re heading further down the rabbit hole into a world where JavaScript is never challenged by a better option.
